steps.title: Download filters from the Internet using websites that provide download links.
steps.content: Download filters from the Internet using websites that provide download links. Some websites offer downloads for free while others can charge quite high prices or specialize in a specific visual theme. Smashing Magazine: this online magazine has an article with a long list of free Photoshop plug-ins and filters that are listed in alphabetical order. Speckyboy: the Speckyboy design magazine has a rated download list, which it considers to be a list of the 25 best free Photoshop plug-ins and filters. Tripwire Magazine: the Design tab in the online Tripwire magazine has an article with over 200 download links for Photoshop filters and other image enhancement elements. Auto FX Software: the Auto FX Software website sells filters that can be bundled for package prices. The costs for some of the filters can be quite high but they are considered to be of very high quality, so purchases are seriously considered at times by professionals and companies dealing with visual arts.

steps.title: Save the filters that you like onto your computer using the download links provided on the website of your choice.
steps.content: Save the filters that you like onto your computer using the download links provided on the website of your choice.

steps.title: Go to the folder where you saved the downloaded filter, right-click on its icon and select "Copy" from the pop-up menu.
steps.content: Go to the folder where you saved the downloaded filter, right-click on its icon and select "Copy" from the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Browse to the "Plug-ins" or "Plugins" folder associated with Photoshop.
steps.content: Browse to the "Plug-ins" or "Plugins" folder associated with Photoshop. This is the folder where you need to add Photoshop filters. You should be able to find the folder using the following steps. Access your primary hard drive through My Computer. The primary hard drive is the same drive in which your operating system is stored (the drive letter is usually "C"). Open the "Program Files" folder. Double-click into the "Adobe" folder. View the contents of the "Photoshop" folder by double-clicking on it. You should see a folder labeled "Plugins" or "Plug-ins."

steps.title: Paste the filter into the filter folder by opening it, right-clicking and selecting "Paste."
steps.content: Paste the filter into the filter folder by opening it, right-clicking and selecting "Paste."

steps.title: Run the Adobe Photoshop software or restart it if you already had it running.
steps.content: Run the Adobe Photoshop software or restart it if you already had it running.

steps.title: Open the image that you want to apply the filter to.
steps.content: Open the image that you want to apply the filter to.

steps.title: Select "Filters" from the top menu.
steps.content: Select "Filters" from the top menu. You should see a list of filters that includes the newly installed filters as well as the pre-installed ones (newer filters usually appear at the bottom of the list).

steps.title: Click on the filter that you want to apply to the image.
steps.content: Click on the filter that you want to apply to the image. This will apply the visual effects associated with the filter to the image (for example, if you select "Retro-Vintage" it will make your image look like an old photograph).
